title: [docs] links to html docs could benefit from scrollTo or similar
body_html:
📚 Documentation

Visit the following link for torch.nn.Module: https://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.Module

After the page finalizes loading it'll jump a little too far, blocking the actual class torch.nn.Module underneath the navbar. This is a bootstrap specific thing, I'm sure the authors of the beautiful new bootstrap based theme know the best way to fix it. You can detect #anchor.text or whatever, but you basically just want to scroll a little bit -- specifically by the size of the navbar -- so that when you click on a docs link the leading class XXX isn't hidden by the navbar.

It's definitely not urgent, but it can get a little confusing 😉

I love the new docs btw, they're beautiful!

body:
## 📚 Documentation

Visit the following link for `torch.nn.Module`: https://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.Module

After the page finalizes loading it'll jump a little too far, blocking the actual `class torch.nn.Module` underneath the navbar.  This is a `bootstrap` specific thing, I'm sure the authors of the beautiful new bootstrap based theme know the best way to fix it.  You can detect `#anchor.text` or whatever, but you basically just want to scroll a little bit -- specifically by the size of the navbar -- so that when you click on a docs link the leading `class XXX` isn't hidden by the navbar.

It's definitely not urgent, but it can get a little confusing :wink:

I love the new docs btw, they're beautiful!
